1.content: Choose ONE backend architecture (Supabase OR Prisma)
1.details: Analyze current usage, recommend primary backend, create migration plan for removing the unused one. Document decision and rationale.

2.details:
Split .env.example into 3 tiers:
- Tier 1 (Core): 5 vars - Database, Auth basics
- Tier 2 (Basic): +8 vars - Payments, Maps
- Tier 3 (Advanced): +27 vars - Social, Delivery
Create separate .env.core, .env.basic, .env.advanced files

3.details: Create /lib/feature-flags.ts that auto-detects configured services and enables features accordingly. Update components to check feature flags before rendering.

4.details: Create /lib/rate-limiter.ts with Redis-based tracking for all external APIs (Twitter, Facebook, Google Maps, etc.). Include remaining quota display and helpful error messages.

5.content: Consolidate documentation into single entry point
5.details: Create new /docs/README.md as single source of truth. Reorganize existing 20+ docs into logical structure: /features/, /deployment/, /api-reference/. Archive redundant docs.

6.details: Build interactive CLI: npm run setup-wizard that asks questions and generates appropriate .env.local with only needed variables based on user's feature choices.

7.details: Implement GET /api/health endpoint that checks connectivity and configuration status of all external services (database, redis, stripe, social APIs, etc.).
